p: The epidemiological situation in the country became even more alarming with the introduction of two other important arboviruses: Zika virus (ZIKV) and Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) [ 13, 14, 15]. The similar pathogenicity shared by those viruses resulted in difficulties in the diagnosis and clinical management [ 6]. In addition, congenital abnormalities, such as microcephaly and Guillain–Barré syndrome, were associated with infection by ZIKV and CHIKV [ 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22].
